intro: Gyrostachys vaginata, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has narrow, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gyrostachys vaginata is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
